form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To clarify that family offices and family clients are accredited investors, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Family Office Technical Correction Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Subject to subsection (b), any family office or a family client of a family office, as defined in section 275.202(a)(11)(G)â€“1 of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations, shall be deemed to be an accredited investor, as defined in Regulation D of the Securities and Exchange Commission (or any successor thereto) under the Securities Act of 1933.

Subsection (a) only applies to a family office with assets under management in excess of $5,000,000, and a family office or a family client not formed for the specific purpose of acquiring the securities offered, and whose purchase is directed by a person who has such knowledge and experience in financial and business matters that such person is capable of evaluating the merits and risks of the prospective investment.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives October 24, 2017.
